ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Microbe identification techniques, including staining and molecular approaches, as well as bacterial genetics and biochemistry techniques.
I learned a lot about culturing bacteria and other relevant lab skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The content was structured. However, it was impossible to know what the professor expected from us in assignments. In quizzes he would ask completely irrelevant questions and take points off for things that were not even mistakes, and no rubrics were provided for the lab reports, so it was hard to know how to do it. The professor was very knowledgeable, however, and I felt like I learned a lot in this class. It just didnt have the best assignments.
Course was very organized and explanations for weekly activities were always very clear. There could be better explanation as to how to prepare for  quizzes
This course is very laid back and gives you the room to learn important lab skills without much stress.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: From what I have heard, there are no outstanding labs in MCDB. This is probably one of the lesser evils. I have heard that the professor is going to change, so maybe that brings more fairness into the assessments.
Yes! This is a great lab credit!
